priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Events Dictionary Derived Term Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124297

self.title: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Events Dictionary Derived Term Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist based on the verbatim or preprinted term for the biospecimen events that occur.
name: Biospecimen Events Dictionary Derived Term
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Biospecimen Events Dictionary Derived Term Terminology

terms.definition: The act of dividing a liquid item into multiple items of smaller volume.
The act of gathering an item.
The act of increasing the density of a substance and decreasing its volume.
The act of maintaining and/or attempting to grow explanted cells in an in vitro environment.
The act of ridding of contamination.
The act of demolishing an item to make it unusable or unanalyzable.
To surround an object with a firm chemical substance such as wax or resin.
To chemically preserve so as to maintain structural and/or molecular features.
To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.
The process whereby cold changes the water component from a liquid to a solid.
The act of separating a molecular component from the original specimen.
Coming into possession of or acting as the receptacle or recipient of an item conveyed by an intermediary to the intended destination, from a sender.
To cut a very thin slice of tissue or other substance.
Being transported or conveyed by an intermediary to a destination, from the sender to the intended receiver.
To dye or tint tissues or other biological samples for the purpose of imaging structures.
The act of safekeeping items in a depository.
The process whereby heat changes the water component from a solid to a liquid.
